info.name: Star Trek API
info.description:
An API covering Characters, Ships, Species, and Ranks from _Star Trek_ eras TNG (The Next Generation) to DS9 (Deep Space 9).

The primary tables are `characters` and `ships`.

Each character will belong to one `species`.

Each character can have held multiple ranks over their lifetime. These character-rank relationships are stored in the `character_rank` table. Each record in the table will reference a character, a rank, and the date that rank took effect.

Each character can also have served aboard multiple ships. These character-ship relationships are stored in the `character_ship` table. Each record will reference a character, a ship, and the date the character began serving on that ship.

#### 404 : ID Not Found
Requests that require an id (GET by id, PUT, DELETE) will return status 404 if the specified id cannot be found.

#### Delete Cascade
When deleting a character, any records in `character_rank` and `character_ship` that reference that character will also be deleted.

Similarly when deleting a ship or rank, any associated records in `character_rank` and `character_ship` will also be deleted.

#### User Generated Content
A `user_generated` field exists on each character, ship, species, and rank record. This property is set to `1` for all POST methods.
In the future, DELETE requests will only be permitted where the `user_generated` value equals `1`.

#### A Note About Canon
Some details may appear to be missing, for example ranks held by Jean-Luc Picard between Ensign and Captain. This lack of information is simply because these details were never established in canon.

request.description: Get a character by `id`.

Create a new character.

### Parameters
- `name` : `String` The character's name.
- `species_id` : `Integer` Species id.
- `gender` : `String` The character's gender, typically `m` for male and `f` for female.
- `dob` : `String` Character's date of birth.
- `actor` : `String` Name of the actor who protrayed the character.
- `image` : `String` URL path to an image.
- `status` : `String` Current status of the character.

Update a character.

### Parameters
- `id` : `Integer` ID of the character to update.
- `name` : `String` The character's name.
- `species_id` : `Integer` Species id.
- `gender` : `String` The character's gender, typically `m` for male and `f` for female.
- `dob` : `String` Character's date of birth.
- `actor` : `String` Name of the actor who protrayed the character.
- `image` : `String` URL path to an image.
- `status` : `String` Current status of the character.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if character was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).

Delete a character by `id`.

_Any character-ship relationship records associated with this character will also be deleted._

_Any character-rank relationship records associated with this character will also be deleted._

item.description:
Requests relating the the `characters` table.

### Fields
- `id` : `Integer` Character id.
- `name` : `String` The character's name.
- `species_id` : `Integer` Species id.
- `gender` : `String` The character's gender, typically `m` for male and `f` for female.
- `dob` : `String` Character's date of birth.
- `actor` : `String` Name of the actor who protrayed the character.
- `image` : `String` URL path to an image.
- `status` : `String` Current status of the character.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if character was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).

request.description: Get a ship by specified `id`.

Create a new ship.

### Parameters
- `name` : `String` The ship's name.
- `registry` : `String` The ship's registry.
- `class` : `String` The ship design classification.
- `status` : `String` Current status of the ship.
- `image` : `String` URL path to an image.

Update a ship.

### Parameters
- `id` : `Integer` ID of the ship to update.
- `name` : `String` The ship's name.
- `registry` : `String` The ship's registry.
- `class` : `String` The ship design classification.
- `status` : `String` Current status of the ship.
- `image` : `String` URL path to an image.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if the ship was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).

Delete a ship by `id`.

_Any character-ship relationship records associated with this ship will also be deleted._

item.description:
Requests relating the the `ships` table.

### Fields
- `id` : `Integer` Ship id.
- `name` : `String` Ship name.
- `registry` : `String` Ship registry.
- `class` : `String` The ship design classification.
- `status` : `String` Current status of the ship.
- `image` : `String` URL path to an image.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if the ship was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).

request.description: Get a species by `id`.

Create a new species record.

### Parameters
- `name` : `String` The species name.
- `origin` : `String` Name of the planet where species originated.

Update a species record.

### Parameters
- `id` : `Integer` ID of species record to update.
- `name` : `String` The species name.
- `origin` : `String` Name of the planet where species originated.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if species was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).
Delete a species by `id`.

item.description:
Requests relating the the `species` table.

This table is referenced by character records in that each character belongs to a single species via its `species_id` property.

### Fields
- `id` : `Integer` Species id.
- `name` : `String` The species name.
- `origin` : `String` Name of the planet where species originated.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if species was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).

item.name: Ranks

request.description: Get all ranks.

response.name: /ranks

request.description: Get a rank by `id`.

Create a new rank.

### Parameters
- `name` - `String` The rank name.

Update a rank record.

### Parameters
- `id` : `Integer` ID of the rank to update.
- `name` : `String` The rank name.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if rank was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).

Delete a rank by `id`.

_Any character-rank relationship records associated with this rank will also be deleted._

item.description:
Requests relating the the `ranks` table.

A character may hold several ranks over their lifetime. See the `CharacterRanks` section to work with these relationships.

### Fields
- `id` : `Integer` Rank id.
- `name` : `String` The rank name.
- `user_generated` : `Integer` Specifies if rank was generated by a user (`1`) or not (`0`).

item.name: CharacterShips

request.description:
Get all character-ship relationships.

These records define the relationship between a character (`character_id`) and a ship (`ship_id`) starting at a specific date (`effective_date`).
That is to say, _when_ a _character_ began serving on a _ship_.
Get a character-ship relationship by its `id`.

Get all character-ship relationships by character `id`.

This call will return all ships that the specified character has served on.

Get all character-ship relationships by ship `id`.

This call will return all characters that have served on the specified ship.

response.name: /characterships/byshipid/id

request.description:
Create a new character-ship relationship.

This call creates a new relationship between a character and a ship at a specific date.

### Parameters
- `character_id` : `Integer` Character id.
- `ship_id` : `Integer` Ship id.
- `effective_date` : `String` Date that marks the start of the relationship.

Update a character-ship relationship.

### Parameters
- `id` : `Integer` ID of the record to update.
- `character_id` : `Integer` Character ID.
- `ship_id` : `Integer` Ship ID
- `effective_date` : `String` Date that marks the start of the relationship.
Delete a character-ship relationship record by `id`.

item.description:
Requests relating the the `character_ship` table.

A character may serve aboard multiple ships over their lifetime. This section details working with these relationships. Each record contains a character id, a ship id, and the date this relationship began.

### Fields
- `id` : `Integer` ID of the record.
- `character_id` : `Integer` ID of the character.
- `ship_id` : `Integer` ID of the ship.
- `effective_date` : `String` Date the character began serving on the ship.

item.name: CharacterRanks

request.description:
Get all character-rank relationships.

These records define the relationship between a character (`character_id`) and a rank (`rank_id`) beginning on a specific date (`effective_date`).
Get a character-rank relationship by `id`.

Get all character-rank relationships by character id.

This call will return all Ranks that the specified character has held, and the dates these ranks took effect.

Create a character-rank relationship.

### Parameters
- `character_id` : `Integer` Character ID.
- `rank_id` : `Integer` Rank ID.
- `effective_date` : `String` Date that marks the start of the relationship.

Update a character-rank relationship.

### Parameters
- `id` : `Integer` ID of the record to update.
- `character_id` : `Integer` Character id.
- `rank_id` : `Integer` Rank id.
- `effective_date` : `String` Date that marks the start of the relationship.
Delete a character-rank relationship by `id`.

item.description:
Requests relating the the `character_rank` table.

A character may hold many ranks over their lifetime. This section details working with these relationships. Each record contains a character id, a rank id, and the date this relationship began.

### Fields
- `id` : `Integer` ID of the record.
- `character_id` : `Integer` ID of the character.
- `rank_id` : `Integer` ID of the rank.
- `effective_date` : `String` Date character attained this rank.
